typography.headingStyle: Bold white sans-serif, all-caps for section headers (e.g., 'My commission')
typography.bodyStyle: Regular light gray sans-serif for descriptive text
typography.dataStyle: Bold red/white text for numeric values and transaction ranges

components.description: More menu with 3 sections: User (Referral, Blog, Docs, Collector, Airdrop, Terms), Developer (Explore, Testnet, Brand Assets, Github), Media (Twitter, Medium, Discord)
components.notable: Clean icon-text pairs organized by user type

components.description: Red gradient curve showing commission trajectory across transaction ranges
components.notable: Interactive range buttons (0-50TX, 50-500TX, 500-2000TX, 2000-10000TX, >10000TX) with selected state styling

components.description: Centered inbox icon with 'No data available' message
components.notable: Subtle line-icon design consistent with platform aesthetic

components.description: Connect Wallet primary CTA in red
components.notable: Full-width, high contrast against dark background

design.visualHierarchy: Eye drawn to: 1) Referral modal on left, 2) Commission chart on right, 3) Empty commission state below, 4) Section headers create clear breaks
innovativeElements: Curved red-gradient chart visualization for commission scaling
Contextual range selection buttons overlaying the chart

flow.userIntent: View referral commission structure, understand earning potential, connect wallet to start referring
entryPoints: Landing on account settings or rewards area
exitPoints: Connect Wallet button → wallet connection flow
Claimed Record button → historical referral data
Navigation menu items (Trade, Market, Quests, etc.) → other sections
External links (Twitter, Medium, Discord, Github, Docs)

interactiveElements.action: Filter/highlight commission curve for selected TX volume
Initiate wallet authentication to enable referral program

flow.informationArchitecture: Referral mechanics → Visual commission structure → Commission history → Related resources; structured as: overview (chart + ranges) → settled commissions section → transaction history section
frictionPoints: Wallet must be connected before accessing referral data
Empty state provides no guidance on next steps or how to generate referrals
Settlement date note (5th of every month) is small and yellow, could be missed
progressIndicators: Transaction volume thresholds shown on chart
Claimed Record button suggests past activity tracking

microcopy.purpose: Sets expectation for when commissions are paid out
Indicates user hasn't generated referral volume yet
Breaks down commission tiers by transaction volume

typography.headingStyle: Sans-serif, white, medium weight, minimal caps
typography.bodyStyle: Sans-serif, light gray, regular weight for labels
typography.dataStyle: Large monospace numbers in white/gray for amounts, smaller gray text for estimated values

components.description: Horizontal navigation with logo and menu items (Trade, Market, Quests, More)
components.notable: Clean minimalist nav with Connect Wallet CTA on top-right

components.description: Centered card with deposit flow visualization (USDC → Hyperliquid)
components.notable: Teal/green badge styling with arrow flow indicator showing token pair

components.description: Two-section form with Sell and Buy fields, token selectors, and value displays
components.notable: Dark gray form sections with clear visual separation between sell/buy

components.description: Full-width coral/red button for wallet connection
components.notable: High contrast color draws attention, disabled state until wallet connects

design.visualHierarchy: Eye enters at top with nav, flows to centered swap card, then down through form inputs to CTA button. Starfield background creates depth.
innovativeElements: Animated particle/starfield background in dark red/orange gradient
Flow visualization with directional arrow between token pairs
Swap direction indicator with chevron/toggle icon between sell/buy sections

flow.userIntent: Initiate a token swap from USDC to Hyperliquid

interactiveElements.action: Input numeric value for amount to sell
Dropdown to select token being sold (currently Arbitrum)
Chevron button to reverse sell/buy directions
Dropdown to select token being purchased (currently Not Selected)

flow.informationArchitecture: Linear flow: select sell token → enter amount → select buy token → enter amount → connect wallet. Information grouped by transaction sides (Sell/Buy).
frictionPoints: Buy token must be manually selected (Not Selected state)
Form appears locked/disabled until wallet connects

typography.headingStyle: Sans-serif, white, regular weight for menu categories
typography.bodyStyle: Sans-serif, light gray, regular weight for menu items with icons

components.description: Three-column menu overlay showing User, Developer, and Media sections with icon+text items
components.notable: Dark semi-transparent background with organized icon+text pairs, clear categorization

components.description: User section (Referral, Blog, Docs, Collector, Airdrop, Terms of Use), Developer section (Explore, Testnet, Brand Assets, Github), Media section (Twitter, Medium, Discord)
components.notable: Six menu items per column for balanced visual weight

design.visualHierarchy: Menu overlays main swap form. Column headers establish hierarchy. Icons + text provide quick scanning.
innovativeElements: Three-column categorical menu layout within single dropdown
Icon-text pairing for each menu item for visual scanning

flow.userIntent: Access additional resources, community links, and developer tools
entryPoints: More menu button click from top navigation
exitPoints: Any menu item selection (Referral, Blog, Docs, Collector, Airdrop, Terms of Use, Explore, Testnet, Brand Assets, Github, Twitter, Medium, Discord)
flow.informationArchitecture: Menu items grouped into three contextual categories: User (account/community), Developer (tools/resources), Media (social channels). Flat hierarchy within each column.
